author: Jean-Pierre
content: Will they be doing a “Collectors Edition” to milk as much money as possible out of the remaining stocks?

author: Linda Collison
content: Maybe someone else can print paper charts?

author: Erik Abranson
content:
Fully automated uncrewed vessels — they already exist — don’t need paper charts. They do not even need monitor screens. Seafaring is about to rejoin with flintstone knapping, arrow fletching, coopering and other callings.
Computer-assisted collisions or strandings have already been reported. Fully human pirates, already numerous on the Internet, will be guiding vessels to places where their cargoes can be plundered and hostile viruses are being developped to cause enemy ships to run one another down. Artifical intelligence will fully deserve its name when it has figured out how to phase out Apes altogether…
